content:
PrintDialog Class

In this Article

Invokes a standard Microsoft Windows print dialog box that configures a PrintTicket and stem.Printing.PrintQueue according to user input and then prints a document.

Syntax

Declaration

public class PrintDialog

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • PrintDialog

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

A user can use the Print dialog box to select a printer, configure it, and perform a print job.

Strictly speaking, you can use the PrintDocument method without ever opening the dialog. In that sense, the control can be used as an unseen printing component. But for performance reasons, it would be better to use either the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.AddJob%2A> method or one of the many <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>. For more about this, see How to: Programmatically Print XPS Files.

Do not confuse this class, PrintDialog, with System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog. The latter is used with Windows Forms applications. PrintDialog is used with Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) applications.

Constructors summary

PrintDialog()

Initializes a new instance of the PrintDialog class.

Properties summary

CurrentPageEnabled

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the option to print the current page is enabled.
MaxPage

Gets or sets the highest page number that is allowed in page ranges.
MinPage

Gets or sets the lowest page number that is allowed in page ranges.
PageRange

Gets or sets the range of pages to print when stem.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.PageRangeSelection* is set to PageRangeSelection.
PageRangeSelection

Gets or sets the PageRangeSelection for this instance of PrintDialog.
PrintableAreaHeight

Gets the height of the printable area of the page.
PrintableAreaWidth

Gets the width of the printable area of the page.
PrintQueue

Gets or sets a stem.Printing.PrintQueue that represents the printer that is selected.
PrintTicket

Gets or sets the PrintTicket that is used by the PrintDialog when the user clicks Print for the current print job.
SelectedPagesEnabled

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the option to print the selected pages is enabled.
UserPageRangeEnabled

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether users of the Print dialog box have the option to specify ranges of pages to print.

Methods summary

PrintDocument(DocumentPaginator,String)

Prints a DocumentPaginator object to the stem.Printing.PrintQueue that is currently selected.
PrintVisual(Visual,String)

Prints a visual (non-text) object, which is derived from the Visual class, to the stem.Printing.PrintQueue that is currently selected.
ShowDialog()

Invokes the PrintDialog as a modal dialog box.

Constructors

  • PrintDialog()

    Initializes a new instance of the PrintDialog class.

    public PrintDialog ();

Properties

  • CurrentPageEnabled

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the option to print the current page is enabled.

    public bool CurrentPageEnabled { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the option to print the current page is enabled; otherwise, false.

  • MaxPage

    Gets or sets the highest page number that is allowed in page ranges.

    public uint MaxPage { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • UInt32

      A UInt32 that represents the highest page number that can be used in a page range in the Print dialog box.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The property is being set to less than 1.

    Remarks

    Users who click Print when the Print dialog box is set to print pages outside the range that is set by the MaxPage and MinPage values will get an error message advising them of the maximum and minimum page numbers. Nothing will be printed.

  • MinPage

    Gets or sets the lowest page number that is allowed in page ranges.

    public uint MinPage { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • UInt32

      A UInt32 that represents the lowest page number that can be used in a page range in the Print dialog box.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The property is being set to less than 1.

    Remarks

    Users who click Print when the Print dialog box is set to print pages outside the range that is set by the MaxPage and MinPage values will get an error message advising them of the maximum and minimum page numbers. Nothing will be printed.

  • PageRange

    Gets or sets the range of pages to print when stem.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.PageRangeSelection* is set to PageRangeSelection.

    public System.Windows.Controls.PageRange PageRange { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • PageRange

      A PageRange that represents the range of pages that are printed.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The PageRange object that is being used to set the property has either the beginning of the range or the end of the range set to a value that is less than 1.

  • PageRangeSelection

    Gets or sets the PageRangeSelection for this instance of PrintDialog.

    public System.Windows.Controls.PageRangeSelection PageRangeSelection { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • PageRangeSelection

      The PageRangeSelection value that represents the type of page range to print.

    Example

    The following example shows how to set the PageRangeSelection property by using Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) markup and code. 

    <Button Width="200" Click="InvokePrint">Invoke PrintDialog</Button>

    ... 

    private void InvokePrint(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)
    {
        // Create the print dialog object and set options
        PrintDialog pDialog = new PrintDialog();
        pDialog.PageRangeSelection = PageRangeSelection.AllPages;
        pDialog.UserPageRangeEnabled = true;

        // Display the dialog. This returns true if the user presses the Print button.
        Nullable<Boolean> print = pDialog.ShowDialog();
        if (print == true)
        {
            XpsDocument xpsDocument = new XpsDocument("C:\\FixedDocumentSequence.xps", FileAccess.ReadWrite);
            FixedDocumentSequence fixedDocSeq = xpsDocument.GetFixedDocumentSequence();
            pDialog.PrintDocument(fixedDocSeq.DocumentPaginator, "Test print job");
        }
    }

    Private Sub InvokePrint(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As RoutedEventArgs)
		' Create the print dialog object and set options
		Dim pDialog As New PrintDialog()
		pDialog.PageRangeSelection = PageRangeSelection.AllPages
		pDialog.UserPageRangeEnabled = True

		' Display the dialog. This returns true if the user presses the Print button.
		Dim print? As Boolean = pDialog.ShowDialog()
		If print = True Then
			Dim xpsDocument As New XpsDocument("C:\FixedDocumentSequence.xps", FileAccess.ReadWrite)
			Dim fixedDocSeq As FixedDocumentSequence = xpsDocument.GetFixedDocumentSequence()
			pDialog.PrintDocument(fixedDocSeq.DocumentPaginator, "Test print job")
		End If
End Sub
  • PrintableAreaHeight

    Gets the height of the printable area of the page.

    public double PrintableAreaHeight { get; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      A Double that represents the height of the printable page area.

    Example

    The following example shows how to get the value of the PrintableAreaHeight property by using Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) markup and code. 

    <Button Width="200" Click="GetHeight">Get the Printable Height</Button>

    ... 

    private void GetHeight(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)
{
    PrintDialog pDialog = new PrintDialog();
    PrintTicket pt = pDialog.PrintTicket;   //force initialization of the dialog's PrintTicket or PrintQueue
    txt1.Text = pDialog.PrintableAreaHeight.ToString() + " is the printable height";
}

    Private Sub GetHeight(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As RoutedEventArgs)
	Dim pDialog As New PrintDialog()
	Dim pt As PrintTicket = pDialog.PrintTicket 'force initialization of the dialog's PrintTicket or PrintQueue
	txt1.Text = pDialog.PrintableAreaHeight.ToString() & " is the printable height"
End Sub
  • PrintableAreaWidth

    Gets the width of the printable area of the page.

    public double PrintableAreaWidth { get; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      A Double that represents the width of the printable page area.

    Example

    The following example shows how to get the value of the PrintableAreaWidth property by using Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) markup and code. 

    <Button Width="200" Click="GetWidth">Get the Printable Width</Button>

    ... 

    private void GetWidth(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)
{
    PrintDialog pDialog = new PrintDialog();
    PrintQueue pq = pDialog.PrintQueue;     //force initialization of the dialog's PrintTicket or PrintQueue
    txt2.Text = pDialog.PrintableAreaWidth.ToString() + " is the printable width";
}

    Private Sub GetWidth(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As RoutedEventArgs)
	Dim pDialog As New PrintDialog()
	Dim pq As PrintQueue = pDialog.PrintQueue 'force initialization of the dialog's PrintTicket or PrintQueue
	txt2.Text = pDialog.PrintableAreaWidth.ToString() & " is the printable width"
End Sub
  • PrintQueue

    Gets or sets a stem.Printing.PrintQueue that represents the printer that is selected.

    public System.Printing.PrintQueue PrintQueue { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • System.Printing.PrintQueue

      The stem.Printing.PrintQueue that the user selected.

  • PrintTicket

    Gets or sets the PrintTicket that is used by the PrintDialog when the user clicks Print for the current print job.

    public System.Printing.PrintTicket PrintTicket { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • PrintTicket

      A PrintTicket that is used the next time the Print button in the dialog box is clicked.

      Setting this PrintTicket property does not validate or modify the specified PrintTicket for a particular stem.Printing.PrintQueue. If needed, use the stem.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket* method to create a stem.Printing.PrintQueue-specific PrintTicket that is valid for a given printer.

    Remarks

    Neither setting nor getting this property validates the PrintTicket. To validate it use <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A>.

  • SelectedPagesEnabled

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the option to print the selected pages is enabled.

    public bool SelectedPagesEnabled { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the option to print the selected pages is enabled; otherwise, false.

  • UserPageRangeEnabled

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether users of the Print dialog box have the option to specify ranges of pages to print.

    public bool UserPageRangeEnabled { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the option is available; otherwise, false.

    Example

    The following example shows how to set the UserPageRangeEnabled property by using Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) markup and code. 

    <Button Width="200" Click="InvokePrint">Invoke PrintDialog</Button>

    ... 

    private void InvokePrint(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)
    {
        // Create the print dialog object and set options
        PrintDialog pDialog = new PrintDialog();
        pDialog.PageRangeSelection = PageRangeSelection.AllPages;
        pDialog.UserPageRangeEnabled = true;

        // Display the dialog. This returns true if the user presses the Print button.
        Nullable<Boolean> print = pDialog.ShowDialog();
        if (print == true)
        {
            XpsDocument xpsDocument = new XpsDocument("C:\\FixedDocumentSequence.xps", FileAccess.ReadWrite);
            FixedDocumentSequence fixedDocSeq = xpsDocument.GetFixedDocumentSequence();
            pDialog.PrintDocument(fixedDocSeq.DocumentPaginator, "Test print job");
        }
    }

    Private Sub InvokePrint(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As RoutedEventArgs)
		' Create the print dialog object and set options
		Dim pDialog As New PrintDialog()
		pDialog.PageRangeSelection = PageRangeSelection.AllPages
		pDialog.UserPageRangeEnabled = True

		' Display the dialog. This returns true if the user presses the Print button.
		Dim print? As Boolean = pDialog.ShowDialog()
		If print = True Then
			Dim xpsDocument As New XpsDocument("C:\FixedDocumentSequence.xps", FileAccess.ReadWrite)
			Dim fixedDocSeq As FixedDocumentSequence = xpsDocument.GetFixedDocumentSequence()
			pDialog.PrintDocument(fixedDocSeq.DocumentPaginator, "Test print job")
		End If
End Sub

Methods

  • PrintDocument(DocumentPaginator,String)

    Prints a DocumentPaginator object to the stem.Printing.PrintQueue that is currently selected.

    public void PrintDocument (System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator documentPaginator, string description);

    Parameters

    • documentPaginator
      DocumentPaginator

      The DocumentPaginator object to print.

    • description
      String

      A description of the job that is to be printed. This text appears in the user interface (UI) of the printer.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      documentPaginator is null.

  • PrintVisual(Visual,String)

    Prints a visual (non-text) object, which is derived from the Visual class, to the stem.Printing.PrintQueue that is currently selected.

    public void PrintVisual (System.Windows.Media.Visual visual, string description);

    Parameters

    • visual
      Visual

      The Visual to print.

    • description
      String

      A description of the job that is to be printed. This text appears in the user interface (UI) of the printer.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      visual is null.

  • ShowDialog()

    Invokes the PrintDialog as a modal dialog box.

    public Nullable<bool> ShowDialog ();

    Returns

    • Nullable<Boolean>

      true if a user clicks Print; false if a user clicks Cancel; or null if a user closes the dialog box without clicking Print or Cancel.

    Example

    The following example shows how to use the ShowDialog method in code. 

    private void InvokePrint(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)
    {
        // Create the print dialog object and set options
        PrintDialog pDialog = new PrintDialog();
        pDialog.PageRangeSelection = PageRangeSelection.AllPages;
        pDialog.UserPageRangeEnabled = true;

        // Display the dialog. This returns true if the user presses the Print button.
        Nullable<Boolean> print = pDialog.ShowDialog();
        if (print == true)
        {
            XpsDocument xpsDocument = new XpsDocument("C:\\FixedDocumentSequence.xps", FileAccess.ReadWrite);
            FixedDocumentSequence fixedDocSeq = xpsDocument.GetFixedDocumentSequence();
            pDialog.PrintDocument(fixedDocSeq.DocumentPaginator, "Test print job");
        }
    }

    Private Sub InvokePrint(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As RoutedEventArgs)
		' Create the print dialog object and set options
		Dim pDialog As New PrintDialog()
		pDialog.PageRangeSelection = PageRangeSelection.AllPages
		pDialog.UserPageRangeEnabled = True

		' Display the dialog. This returns true if the user presses the Print button.
		Dim print? As Boolean = pDialog.ShowDialog()
		If print = True Then
			Dim xpsDocument As New XpsDocument("C:\FixedDocumentSequence.xps", FileAccess.ReadWrite)
			Dim fixedDocSeq As FixedDocumentSequence = xpsDocument.GetFixedDocumentSequence()
			pDialog.PrintDocument(fixedDocSeq.DocumentPaginator, "Test print job")
		End If
End Sub
